name: Rydges Wellington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights and whilst the rooms were lovely and we had a great view we did feel a little put off by a couple of things. Firstly free wifi, this was limited to 20 mins a day but you had to log in and if you didnt you don't accumulate it you just lose it and acting for it was expensive. We thought this a little strange ESP as its pretty standard now, even in places like India, even Asda has free wifi in its stores! Clearly it doesnt cost the hotel anymore. Second issue, breakfast on the first day was v busy and the staff were really good at dealing with everyone. My husband was asked if he wanted a coffee, my husband said yes assuming it was part of thebreakfast buffet we had paid for. The waitor brought him an expresso and charged us for it, we didn't realise until the following day when he asked for one and they told him they would charge for it. This came up on our bill at the end of our stay and I queried it but the staff member wouldn't take it off.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel centrally located but not free wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the bed, which was one of the most comfortable I can remember in any hotel, the rest of the experience was distinctly average. Nothing particularly bad to report, just not as nice as I expected and also at the other end of the city centre from where you really need to be for restaurants and bars of Courtenay Place. Definitely expected more from this hotel. Probably a better bet for business travellers.
reviews.title: A distinctly average hotel

reviews.text: Really that word says it all - & in a positive way I hasten to add!
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff without exception treated us with the utmost of respect in a friendly & professional way. Everyone from the room maids, reception staff to the waiters, bar staff & concierge. 2 members of staff Ivan & Phil were nothing short of exceptional.
reviews.title: Usual Rydges quality
Good, solid hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was immaculately clean (& believe me I am very fussy & check!!) & our every comfort was taken care of.

The Rydges Wellington wants to be a great hotel, but it's not quite there yet. The rooms themselves are pretty great and, unlike many other Wellington hotels, come with an air-conditioner. The rooms also have fridge, toaster and stove-top (though cookware must be requested). That said, small things stop this from being a five-star hotel. For starters, the laundry service is prohibitively expensive ($6/article). It is possible to do a traveller's wash but why you should have to in a hotel at this price is beyond me. Other small annoyances on my trip include the toilet becoming quite pungent after flushing and a 2% surcharge on credit card payments. That said, it's a fine hotel for sleeping (especially in summer) with some great package inclusions. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great with a few rough edges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Rydges, Wellington in early January and found the hotel very pleasant and was very well located to everything. Breakfast was lovely and the staff were very helpful with parking on the last day letting us leave our car there as long as we needed to as our flight back to Australia was not until much later in the day. There are some lovely restaurants close by and the museum and botanical gardens only a short walk. Shopping also close by. Would recommend Rydges for a nice middle of the road stay - rooms clean and comfortable. As an extra bonus we had great weather!
reviews.title: Very happy with stay at Rydges

reviews.text: Typical Rydges hotel, bland, overpriced.... Priced like a luxury hotel, even a smart foyer, but stuffy staff leave you feeling you shouldn't have bothered them, huge charges for WiFi, no breakfast, etc... Will avoid from now on...
reviews.title: Overpriced and average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally placed for the harbour and museums. Nice view of the harbour The rooms are quiet and comfortable. The front of house staff are helpful and friendly. The restaurant is good. However the hotel is let down by its housekeeping staff who appear to lack any supervision or checks on their work. We stayed for 4 nights and once had to ask reception to get someone to clean our bathroom as it had not been cleaned and then on another day despite having the please service my room sign out our room was not visied at all by housekeepng and again we had to ask reception to sort it out. The lifts also were not very clean.
reviews.title: Ideally placed but poor housekeeping lets it down

reviews.text: I stayed there for 4 nights - mixture of business and leisure. The rooms are a good size with excellent modern facilities and conducive to a very comfortable stay. I used the evening room service twice for a meal and i would say the choice and standard of the food was well above average - really tasty comtemporary food at reasonable prices. Location of the hotel is excellent - Wellington is a very accessible city in any case but i thought the hotel was in a good connected spot but quiet.
reviews.title: Generally very good - a few things to work on.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Rydges for 2 nights whilst in Wellington for a reunion. I found a good deal on their website, it is free to become a Priority Guest Rewards member, which included welcome drinks and breakfast. The breakfast buffet is quite comprehensive with something for everyone. They also have 20mins free wifi daily.
reviews.title: Great breakfast, good rate

reviews.text: The room, deluxe king, was fine. It had everything we needed and was clean with a nice view of the harbour. We rang in the morning of departure and asked for a late check out. This was granted easily with no extra payment for 2 extra hours. The staff were very accommodating, also ordering taxis for us and storing our bags.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. Close to Lambton Quay shopping and near some good resaurants.
reviews.title: Rydges queenstown

reviews.text: I travel to Wellington regularly for work and we always stay at Rydges. I always enjoy my stay here as the staff are super helpful, the rooms are great and the location is so central that you can walk anywhere in the CBD within 15 minutes. A bonus for this hotel is that it has full cooking facilities, and if you need a pot or pan just ask for one...Although please don't cook any fish or you'll upset everyone on your floor... lol... It is also a modernised and updated hotel so it has flat screen TV's, iPod dock etc
reviews.title: A Very Good Choice

reviews.text: I use the gym, sauna, & lap pool facilities when I stay here as well. Great Bar and Restaurant downstairs too.
reviews.title: Depending!
Ab Fab
reviews.text: I stayed here just for the night and found it absolutely fabulous. Helpful staff, central and very comfy. Recommend highly. Waterfront is just across the road as well as some great places to eat down below.

reviews.title: Central location for our short Wellington stay
reviews.text: We were in Wellington for just one night before taking the ferry across to Picton the next morning. A Apex car rental facility staff member drove us to the hotel when we returned our rental car, so we didn't have to worry with driving directions or parking issues that other reviewers have mentioned. We had a clean, comfortable, quiet room on the 9th floor. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the sights that we had planned to see during our short stay - the "Beehive," the cable car, and the waterfront. We also found a nice sports bar where we had dinner, followed by a leisurely stroll along the waterfront. My husband had a bit of difficulty with the short duration of the complimentary wi-fi, but front desk staff worked out the issue to his satisfaction. Front desk staff was also very helpful with getting our taxi for the ride to the ferry, noticing that we were ready to go earlier than we had originally said, and taking the initiative to offer to get an earlier taxi for us.

reviews.title: We found that the ambiance of the room didn't match with the cost of the room.

reviews.title: Windy Wellington
reviews.text: Room was decorated in black, white and red and quite nice, however the $30 valet charge was unexpected. Oh, by the way, the view out of our hotel window was a conversation started, after our hour drive in circles trying to find the hotel! See pic. The Pope and 2 homosexual people speaking about the energy in NZ...lhmmm At least it made us stop and take a break after the stress of trying to find the Rydges within the small radius that we knew it was... due to the poor signage. No ocean/city view... only the Pope as mentioned above.

description: Rydges Wellington is located on downtown Featherston Street with a unique combination of harbour views and city outlooks. Ideally situated in New Zealand’s capital city, Rydges Wellington is within close distance to the Westpac Stadium, Queens Wharf, Wellington Railway Station, both the Interislander and Bluebridge Ferry terminals and Lambton Quay for shopping.This 4+ Star hotel offers 280 accommodation rooms for business and leisure guests with the benefits of modern facilities including wireless internet throughout, iPads for guests and fantastic leisure facilities. All rooms feature flat screen televisions, iPod docking stations and kitchenettes. There are 19 apartment style suites, perfect for your long stay requirements with washer and drier facilities available. Rydges Wellington is your landmark hotel in the Capital.
